cz.upol.inf.vanusanik.jwlc

Class Resource

  • java.lang.Object
    • cz.upol.inf.vanusanik.jwlc.Resource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PointerContainer

    public class Resource
extends Object
implements PointerContainer
    Abstract wrapper to wlc_resource. Mostly handles surfaces.
    Author:
    enerccio

      • getTextures

        public Resource.Textures getTextures()
        Returns:
        three textures for this surface.
        See Also:
        #getTextures(int count) getTextures(int)}

      • getTextures

        public Resource.Textures getTextures(int count)
        Creates Resource.Textures object with provided count (must be above 2). Fills Resource.Textures.textures with textures of this surface. Textures object should be refreshed every frame. Note that these are not only OpenGL textures but rather render-specific. For more info what they are check the renderer's source code
        Parameters:
        count - number of textures (3 or more)
        Returns:
        instance or null if surface is invalid

      • asView

        public View asView()
        Returns view handle from this resource (if this resource is view resource).

        public Resource convertInternalWLCSurface()

      • convertToView

        public View convertToView(WaylandClient client,
                          WaylandInterface wayInterface,
                          PointerContainer implementation,
                          long version,
                          long id,
                          PointerContainer userdata)
        Turns this surface resource into a View. Returns null on failure. This will also trigger view.created callback as any view would. For the extra arguments see details of wl_resource_create and wl_resource_set_implementation. The extra arguments may be set null, if you are not implementing Wayland interface for the surface role.
        Parameters:
        client - can be null
        wayInterface - can be null
        implementation - can be null
        version -
        id -
        userdata - can be null
        Returns:

      • flushFrameCallbacks

        public void flushFrameCallbacks()
        Adds frame callbacks of the given surface for the next output frame. It applies recursively to all subsurfaces. Useful when the compositor creates custom animations which require disabling internal rendering, but still need to update the surface textures (for ex. video players).
